reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

As a play tester who's been playing since February (not the first, definitely) and a person who greenlit the original request, I feel proud on taking a part of this game.

I'll give you some pros and cons of this game.

Pros:

All that building aspects from all your favorite survival games, but without the hassle of survival games.
Many models to choose from, game is solid.
All swears are blocked.
Public server is really great, and the game in singleplayer will give you hours of enjoyment.

Cons:

Unity Engine is not optimized for some lower grade computers.
This isn't the developer's fault, he tried alot. And the game runs at about 120 fps on singleplayer for me and 60 on the public multiplayer server.
Not optimized for (very) bad internet connections. If the server has too many objects, it's possible you'll timeout.


Don't let the cons discourage you, this game is worth trying! You'll love it, I'm sure.

- Engitly

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

Concrete and Steel is a sandbox game where, you guessed it, build stuff. Now, while I love creative games, this one fell short for me. I'm not sure if it's because of the pretty early state that the game is in, but I think really what did it for me was how frustrating the controls were. And in the end, it really didn't do much more than what other games already do. I kind of don't see a point in playing this when there are so many games that are exactly like this and actually perform better. So maybe you can build really cool big structures with this, but I couldn't see myself continuing to be frustrated by the controls any longer.

I generally do hope that the developers find fun ways to differentiate this game from others, because right now it doesn't feel like an improvement over games I already play.

If you want to check out some gameplay of this game:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KsxpFwcK7mA
